body:
Hi all,

I wonder if this is already possible, and if not I’d like to request it as a feature.

I have my workflow code written in Java, but for some activities I’d prefer to write them in Python. Is there a way today to link Python-written activities to a Java workflow runner?

If not, I think it would be really helpful to have official support or patterns for mixing activity implementations across languages. This would make it easier to use the right language for the right task without having to rewrite the entire workflow or spin up fully separate workers.

Thanks!

comments.body: It is 100% supported and often the reason that users pick Temporal. See this sample for reference: https://github.com/temporalio/temporal-polyglot

title: Support for Running Activities in Python within Java Workflows
